com.github.sbaudoin.yamllint.rules

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.sbaudoin.yamllint.rules.Rule
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommentRule, LineRule, TokenRule

    public abstract class Rule
extends Object
    The class represents a coding rule. It is not intended to be extended directly; instead, you are encouraged to extend the derivated classes CommentRule, LineRule and TokenRule.
    See Also:
    CommentRule, LineRule, TokenRule

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public String getId()
        Returns the ID of this rule. The default implementation returns the simple class' name (name without package) in lower case and the "words" (identified by the capital letters) separated with an hyphen.
        Returns:
        the rule ID

      • setIgnore

        public void setIgnore(List<String> ignore)
        Sets the regex patterns to tell is files are ignored
        Parameters:
        ignore - list of regex patterns representing files to be ignored by this rule

      • ignores

        public boolean ignores(File file)
        Tells if the passed file is to be ignored by this rule
        Parameters:
        file - a file
        Returns:
        true if the passed file is to be ignored, false if not

      • getLevel

        public String getLevel()
        Returns the level or the problems returned by this rule
        Returns:
        an error level
        See Also:
        Linter

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel(String level)
        Sets the error level of the problems returned by this rule
        Parameters:
        level - the error level for this rule
        See Also:
        Linter

        public Object getParameter(String name)
        Returns the value of the passed parameter
        Parameters:
        name - a parameter name
        Returns:
        the value of the passed parameter or null if not found

      • getOptions

        public Map<String,Object> getOptions()
        Returns the rule's options. This is a very generic container: see the rule details for the exact list and possible values for the options.
        Returns:
        the rules options

        public abstract Rule.TYPE getType()
        Returns the type of this rule
        Returns:
        the rule type

      • spacesAfter

        protected LintProblem spacesAfter(org.yaml.snakeyaml.tokens.Token token,
                                  org.yaml.snakeyaml.tokens.Token next,
                                  @Nullable
                                  Integer min,
                                  @Nullable
                                  Integer max,
                                  String minDesc,
                                  String maxDesc)
        Determines the number of spaces between the passed token and the next one and compares this number with the min and max accepted values. In the event the determined number of spaces is less than or greater than the min and max value, a problem is returned with the corresponding error message.
        Parameters:
        token - the token to analyse
        next - the next token with which the spaces are counted
        min - the minimum number or expected spaces. May be null, in which case -1 is taken (no minimum required).
        max - the maximum number or expected spaces. May be null, in which case -1 is taken (no maximum required).
        minDesc - the problem description in case the number of spaces is less than min
        maxDesc - the problem description in case the number of spaces is greater than max
        Returns:
        a problem or null if no problem found

      • spacesBefore

        protected LintProblem spacesBefore(org.yaml.snakeyaml.tokens.Token token,
                                   org.yaml.snakeyaml.tokens.Token prev,
                                   @Nullable
                                   Integer min,
                                   @Nullable
                                   Integer max,
                                   String minDesc,
                                   String maxDesc)
        Determines the number of spaces between the passed token and the previous one and compares this number with the min and max accepted values. In the event the determined number of spaces is less than or greater than the min and max value, a problem is returned with the corresponding error message.
        Parameters:
        token - the token to analyse
        prev - the previous token with which the spaces are counted
        min - the minimum number or expected spaces. May be null, in which case -1 is taken (no minimum required).
        max - the maximum number or expected spaces. May be null, in which case -1 is taken (no maximum required).
        minDesc - the problem description in case the number of spaces is less than min
        maxDesc - the problem description in case the number of spaces is greater than max
        Returns:
        a problem or null if no problem found

      • isExplicitKey

        protected boolean isExplicitKey(org.yaml.snakeyaml.tokens.Token token)
        Tells if the passed token is an explicit key or not. Explicit key: 
           ? key
   : v
        or 
         ?
     key
   : v
        A key is guessed to be explicit if it starts with a question mark. It is the responsibility of the caller to check that the token corresponds to a key (the instance is a KeyToken).
        Parameters:
        token - a token
        Returns:
        true if the token represents an explicit key, false otherwise

      • getLineIndent

        protected int getLineIndent(org.yaml.snakeyaml.tokens.Token token)
        Finds the indent of the line the token starts in
        Parameters:
        token - a token
        Returns:
        the indent of the line the token starts in

      • isWhitespace

        protected boolean isWhitespace(int i)
        The whitespace characters are: tab (ASCII 9), line feed (ASCII 10), vertical tab (ASCII 11), form feed (ASCII 12), carriage return (ASCII 13), space (ASCII 32)
        Parameters:
        i - an integer representing a character
        Returns:
        true if i is one of the characters listed above, false otherwise

      • find

        protected int find(int[] haystack,
                   int needle,
                   int start,
                   int end)
        Returns the first index of an int in an array of int's. The int is searched for between the start and end-1 indexes. If the int is not found, the method returns -1.
        Parameters:
        haystack - the array of int's in which to search
        needle - the int to look for
        start - the index from which to search
        end - the search is done until the index end-1
        Returns:
        the index (between start and end) if the int is found, -1 otherwise
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if start or end are beyond the boundaries of haystack

      • rfind

        protected int rfind(int[] haystack,
                    int needle,
                    int start,
                    int end)
        Returns the right-most index of an int in an array of int's. The int is searched for between the start and end-1 indexes. If the int is not found, the method returns -1.
        Parameters:
        haystack - the array of int's in which to search
        needle - the int to look for
        start - the index from which to search
        end - the search is done until the index end-1
        Returns:
        the index (between start and end) if the int is found, -1 otherwise
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if start or end are beyond the boundaries of haystack

      • getRealEndLine

        protected int getRealEndLine(org.yaml.snakeyaml.tokens.Token token)
        Finds the line on which the token really ends. With SnakeYAML, scalar tokens often end on a next line.
        Parameters:
        token - a token
        Returns:
        the line on which the token really ends

        protected boolean isDigit(String str)
        Tells if the passed string represents an intege
        Parameters:
        str - a string
        Returns:
        true if the string is an integer, false if not
